The Buddha told Bodhisattva Mind King:

At that time, the World-Honored One spoke in verse to Mind King Bodhisattva, saying:
Inconceivable, inexpressible, filling all the inexpressible,
In the inconceivable eons, speaking of the inexpressible cannot exhaust it.

In each of those hair-paths, there are indescribable pure buddha-lands,
Adorned with indescribable adornments, adorning those buddha-lands.
In each of those hair-paths, there is the indescribable utterance of name-bodies,

In each of those lotus leaves, there are unspeakable subtle colors,ğŸ”½In each of those subtle colors, there emerge unspeakable lotus flowers,
In each of those lotus flowers, there emit unspeakable lights,

In each and every sÅ«tra, the various teachings are explained as inexpressible,

And moreover, within those various teachings, the reliance of sentient beings is explained as inexpressible.
And in each and every hair-pore, the true Dharma is explained for inexpressibly many eons,
Just as in that single hair-tip, so it is in all the ten directions.
The unobstructed mind is inexpressible, and the transformed buddhas are inexpressible,

Incalculably pure jewels, incalculably many jeweled flowers,
Offering to the unspeakably supreme ones.
Their profound faith is inconceivable, pure liberation is inconceivable,
Upright aspirations are inconceivable, respectfully making offerings to all buddhas.
The mind of giving is inconceivable, past giving is inconceivable,

The courageous and vigorous effort is inexpressible, the ultimate wisdom is also inexpressible,
Never leaving a single seat, yet able to universally travel to the worlds in the ten directions.
Inconceivable great eons, universally traveling to the buddha-lands in the ten directions,
The wisdom and skillful means are indescribable, the wisdom of suchness is indescribable,
The pure wisdom that turns [the wheel of Dharma] is indescribable, the moment-to-moment manifestations are indescribable,
In each and every word, understanding the Buddha's wisdom is indescribable.
Sometimes enlightenment is realized in one moment, sometimes enlightenment is realized in various moments,
Entering all hair-tips is indescribable, entering all subtle [realms] is indescribable,
The extraordinary and supreme nature is indescribable, seeing all tathÄgatas is indescribable,
Each and every skillful means is indescribable, skillfully entering the nature of all buddhas in accordance with [their] inclinations.
The nature of all buddha-lands is indescribable, all are able to enter enlightenment in accordance with [their] inclinations,
The indestructible dharma realm is indescribable, the buddhas, sentient beings, and lands are indescribable,
The inclusion of the three times is indescribable, the ultimate of the bodhisattvas is indescribable.
At that time, the Bodhisattva-MahÄsattva Mind King said to the bodhisattvas:
Buddha's disciples!

Chapter 27: The Bodhisattvas' Dwelling Places At that time, the Bodhisattva-MahÄsattva Mind King again said to the Bodhisattvas:
Buddha's disciples!
In the east there is a bodhisattvas' dwelling place called Mountain Where Sages Arise, where past bodhisattvas always dwelled;
there is currently a bodhisattva named Vajra Victory, who resides there with an entourage of three hundred bodhisattvas, constantly expounding the Dharma for them.
In the south there is a bodhisattvas' dwelling place called Mountain of Excellent Towers, where past bodhisattvas always dwelled;
there is currently a bodhisattva named Dharma Wisdom, with an entourage of five hundred bodhisattvas, constantly expounding the Dharma for them.
